thread.title: Kellyanne Conway: Women’s March Participants ‘Just Have a Problem With Women in Power’
thread.title_full: Kellyanne Conway: Women’s March Participants ‘Just Have a Problem With Women in Power’

author: Alex Griswold
title: Kellyanne Conway: Women’s March Participants ‘Just Have a Problem With Women in Power’
text:
Kellyanne Conway: Women’s March Participants ‘Just Have a Problem With Women in Power’ by Alex Griswold | 9:59   
Donald Trump White House counselor Kellyanne Conway said at the Conservative Political Action Committee Thursday morning that the Women’s March participants and others like them had a problem with a woman in power like herself. 
“One thing that’s been a little bit disappointing and revealing and that I hope will get better is, turns out that a lot of women just have a problem with women in power,” she said. 
Conway denounced “this whole sisterhood, this whole ‘let’s go march for women’s rights,’ just constantly talking about what women look like, or what they wear, or making fun of their choices, or presuming that they are not as powerful as the men around.” 
“This presumptive negativity about women in power is very unfortunate because let’s just try to access that and have a conversation about it rather than a confrontation about it,” she said. 
Watch above, via C-SPAN 2. 
[Image via screengrab]
